intro: Arthrostylidium berryi, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry, rocky soils. Its leaves are typically fleshy and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss. Arthrostylidium berryi is often found growing on limestone outcrops and is well-suited to harsh, semi-arid environments.
